intro: Eucalyptus conica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white bloom. The plant produces small, globular flower buds that range in color from white to pink, which are typically clustered in groups of three. Eucalyptus conica is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
